comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Lovin' the pet photos!  Rellies of mine who had a racing yacht in the 1880s ('Galatea' in the 1886 America's Cup) also had a pet monkey on board.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] They're great aren't they?! Wow, what a family history! We have a few GALATEA items from the collection, but they don't seem to be the same yacht... Watch this space, there's more pet pics to come :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] Thanks for the link - that was the HMS GALATEA on which my gg-uncle, William Henn was an officer before its trip to Australia in 1868. He named his own yacht GALATEA after it. He, his wife and the pet monkey lived on board for years. I think they were real characters!

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] So it does relate to HMS GALATEA! How interesting, characters indeedy :)
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: In case you haven't seen it [http://www.flickr.com/photos/47201412@N02/] & [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02/], hot off the press it's [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia/]'s great great uncle's story: anmm.wordpress.com/2013/09/04/seafaring-relatives/ :-D
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons] What an amazing story...why would you spend your days watching make-believe movies when real life is far more interesting!
